mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Prompts
mindfulness.subtitle: Reflect with short prompts or do a quick exercise to return to the present.
mindfulness.tipQuestions: Tip: if you get distracted, take one mindful breath and continue.

questions.q01: What activity makes you lose track of time? Why?
questions.q02: What small act of kindness can you do for someone today?
questions.q03: Think of a challenge you overcame. What did you learn from it?

questions.q06: What quality do you admire in others that you also see in yourself?
questions.q07: What are three things you feel grateful for today?
questions.q08: Describe a sound you can hear right now. What does it make you think of?

questions.q10: If your mind were a sky, what would it be like today: clear, cloudy, stormy‚Ä¶?
questions.q11: What part of your body feels most tense right now? Can you soften it by 5%?
questions.q12: What do you need today: rest, clarity, support, or movement?
questions.q13: What thought has been repeating lately? Does it help you or drain you?
questions.q14: What would your calmer self do in this situation?
questions.q15: What is the smallest thing you can do right now to care for yourself?
questions.q16: What are you trying to control too much?
questions.q17: What can you let go of today (an expectation, a rush, a comparison)?
questions.q18: What has been working lately, even if it‚Äôs something small?
questions.q19: Who brings you calm? What trait of theirs could you apply today?

questions.q21: How would you like to feel at the end of the day? What tiny action moves you closer?
questions.q22: What are you avoiding? What would the easiest first step be?
questions.q23: What do you appreciate about your body today, even something simple?

questions.q28: What can you do in 60 seconds to feel 1% better?

questions.q31: What sensation do you notice in your chest right now? (warmth, pressure, emptiness‚Ä¶)

54321.title: 5-4-3-2-1 (Anchor)
54321.description: Bring your attention to your senses to return to the present.

steps.title: 1/5 ¬∑ 5 things
steps.text: Look around and name 5 things you can see.

steps.title: 2/5 ¬∑ 4 things
steps.text: Name 4 things you can feel in your body (clothes, chair, air‚Ä¶).

steps.title: 3/5 ¬∑ 3 things
steps.text: Listen and name 3 sounds (near or far).

steps.title: 4/5 ¬∑ 2 things
steps.text: Notice 2 smells (or imagine 2 pleasant smells if there aren‚Äôt any).

steps.title: 5/5 ¬∑ 1 thing
steps.text: Name 1 taste (or take a sip of water and describe it).

54321.tip: Go slowly. If you get distracted, return to the step you were on.

escaneo.title: Short Body Scan
escaneo.description: Scan your body and soften gently, without forcing.

steps.title: 1/5 ¬∑ Face
steps.text: Soften your jaw, tongue, and forehead by 5%.

steps.title: 2/5 ¬∑ Shoulders
steps.text: Lift them for 2s and release slowly for 5s.

steps.title: 3/5 ¬∑ Chest
steps.text: Notice your breathing without changing it for 3 cycles.

steps.title: 4/5 ¬∑ Belly
steps.text: Let your belly soften on the exhale. No pushing.

steps.title: 5/5 ¬∑ Legs
steps.text: Feel the weight of your legs and their support.

escaneo.tip: It‚Äôs not about doing it perfectly. It‚Äôs about noticing and softening.

micro.title: Micro-Meditation (2 min)
micro.description: Two minutes to reset: breathing + simple attention.

steps.title: 1/4 ¬∑ Posture
steps.text: Get comfortable. Drop your shoulders and soften your gaze.

steps.title: 3/4 ¬∑ Label
steps.text: If a thought appears: ‚Äúthinking‚Äù, then return to the breath.

steps.title: 4/4 ¬∑ Close
steps.text: Choose one small next action (1 step).

micro.tip: Less is more. The key is returning, not staying perfectly focused.

meditacion.title: Guided meditation
meditacion.description: A gentle session to calm the mind and return to the present.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.hint: Get comfortable. Soften your shoulders and jaw.

steps.title: Breathing
steps.hint: Feel the breath in and out. Don‚Äôt force the rhythm.

steps.title: Body
steps.hint: Scan the body and release tension by 5% in each area.

steps.title: Thoughts
steps.hint: If a thought appears: ‚Äúthinking‚Äù, then come back to the breath.

steps.title: Soft closing
steps.hint: Before you finish, choose one small intention for your day.

relajacion.title: Guided relaxation
relajacion.description: Relax the body step by step and release built-up tension.

steps.title: Settling in
steps.hint: Find a stable, comfortable position. Let your body be supported.

steps.title: Slow breathing
steps.hint: Make the exhale a little longer to let go.

steps.title: Relaxing the body
steps.hint: Soften shoulders, neck, and hands. No rush.

steps.title: Releasing tension
steps.hint: Release what you can now. The rest can wait.

steps.title: Ending / rest
steps.hint: Stay for a few seconds, noticing calm before you finish.
